1_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
2_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
3_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
4_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
5_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
6_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
7_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
9_January: A shadow passes above the Fellowship of the Ring before dawn.
10_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travels towards Caradhras.
11_January: The Fellowship of the Ring camps at the foot of the Redhorn Pass, and that night unsuccessfully tries to cross.
12_January: The Fellowship of the Ring defeated by Caradhras return to Hollin. They camp on a small hill and in the night are attacked by a pack of Wargs.
13_January: Gollum begins to trail the Ring-bearer.
14_January: The Fellowship of the Ring travel through Moria from mid-morning to evening. They spend the night in Hall Twenty-one.
17_January: The Fellowship comes to Caras Galadhon in the evening.
18_January: Saruman hears of the Fellowship of the Ring and sends a company led by Uglúk to intercept them.
19_January: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
20_January: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
21_January: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
23_January: Gandalf pursues the Balrog to the peak of Celebdil.
24_January: Gollum is captured by Uglúk. He later escapes. Saruman sends reinforcements to Uglúk; his troop is now about 180 strong.
25_January: Gandalf casts down the Balrog, and passes away. His body lies on the peak. The Endless Stair is destroyed.
26_January: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
27_January: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
28_January: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
29_January: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
31_January: Note: Months of the Shire Calendar only have 30 days, so no events have nor will happen on the 31st.
1_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
2_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
3_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
4_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
5_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
6_February: Uglúk and his troop search northern Rohan for the Fellowship.
7_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
9_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
10_February: North of Sarn Gebir, Uglúk encounters Grishnákh for the first time.
11_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
12_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
13_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.
14_February: The Fellowship of the Ring rests in Lothlórien.[note 1]
16_February: They travel south over the Anduin by boat while Gollum in hiding observes and follows them.
18_February: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south down the Anduin. Gollum follows them on a log.
19_February: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south down the Anduin. Samwise spots Gollum on his log.
20_February: Gandalf leaves Lothlórien and heads south carried by Gwaihir.
21_February: The Fellowship of the Ring travels south down the Anduin.
23_February: They are ambushed near Sarn Gebir at night. A frightened Gollum flees to the eastern bank and hides in the Emyn Muil. A flying shadow approaches but Legolas shoots it with the bow of Galadriel.
24_February: Treebeard sees Gandalf wandering in Fangorn Forest.
25_February: First Battle of the Fords of Isen. Théodred son of Théoden is slain.
26_February: In Edoras, Éomer hears of the descent of the Orcband from the Emyn Muil.
27_February: Éomer against Théoden's orders sets out from Eastfold about midnight to pursue the Orcs.
28_February: Frodo and Samwise try to find a way through the Emyn Muil.
29_February: Faramir sees the funeral boat of his brother Boromir.
1_March: Death of Arwen Undómiel, the Queen of the Reunited Kingdom, at Cerin Amroth.
2_March: The Ents march on Isengard and reach it at night.
3_March: Battle of Isengard; the Ents, led by Treebeard, change the course of Isen and complete the destruction of Isengard.
4_March: Frodo, Sam and Gollum reach the slag-mounds on the edge of the Desolation of the Morannon.
5_March: Frodo hides in sight of the Morannon, and leaves at dusk.
6_March: Théoden and the éoherë leave Hornburg for Harrowdale and travel under the shadow of the White Mountains of Rohan. Aragorn leaves later, but takes a faster route across the plains of Rohan.
9_March: Faramir reaches Cair Andros in the evening and spends the night there.
10_March: An army of Orcs from the Morannon takes Cair Andros and passes into Anórien.
11_March: Orcs of Dol Guldur assail Lothlórien, but they are beaten back.
12_March: The Ents overcome the invaders of Rohan.
16_March: Frodo and Sam travel northward along the Morgai. They look out over the camp to Mount Doom.
17_March: Shagrat brings Frodo's cloak, mail shirt and sword to Barad-dûr, where he is slain.
18_March: Frodo and Sam come in sight of the Isenmouthe. They are overtaken by the orc-band.
19_March: Frodo and Samwise escape the Orcs and begin their journey along the road to Barad-dûr.
20_March: Faramir meets Éowyn in the Houses of Healing.
22_March: Frodo and Sam leave the road and turn south to Mount Doom.
23_March: Frodo and Sam leave behind their arms and gear.
24_March: The last day of the Third Age, according to the reckoning of Gondor.
25_March: Elanor the Fair, daughter of Samwise, is born.[1]
26_March: Frodo and Sam, rescued out of the fire, rest in Ithilien.
27_March: Frodo and Sam, rescued out of the fire, rest in Ithilien.
28_March: Frodo and Sam, rescued out of the fire, rest in Ithilien.
29_March: Frodo and Sam, rescued out of the fire, rest in Ithilien.
31_March: Note: Months of the Shire Calendar only have 30 days, so no events have nor will happen on the 31st.

6_April: The mallorn tree planted by Samwise Gamgee in the Party Field begins to flower.[2]
8_April: The Ring-bearers Samwise and Frodo are honoured on the Field of Cormallen.
9_April: Eorl the Young and the Éothéod travel towards the Field of Celebrant.
10_April: Eorl the Young and the �oth�od travel towards the Field of Celebrant.
11_April: Eorl the Young and the Éothéod travel towards the Field of Celebrant.
12_April: Gandalf warns Frodo that his ring is dangerous, mentions Sauron to him, but says no more until the morning.[1]
13_April: Samwise Gamgee is caught by Gandalf eavesdropping, and is (happily) obliged to accompany Frodo.
15_April: Together with the �oth�od Gondor is victorious and Cirion, steward of Gondor, gives Calenardhon to Eorl which becomes the later Rohan.

26_April: Gandalf visits Bag End looking for somebody to take part in an adventure but Bilbo rejects the offer.
27_April: Thirteen dwarves and Gandalf arrive at Bag End. Bilbo learns of the Lonely Mountain and Smaug and agrees to accompany the dwarves and Gandalf on their adventure.
28_April: Bilbo leaves Bag End and starts his journey to the Lonely Mountain with Gandalf and the dwarves.
30_April: There are no known events for this day.

22_September: As this day was the birthday of the Ring-bearer Frodo Baggins it became significant to the New Reckoning after the War of the Ring; corresponding to 30 Yavanni�, it was made a festival in honor of Frodo. See also: Cormare

28_September: At night Kham�l and the Ringwraith from Dol Guldur arrive at Crickhollow; Kham�l sends the Dol Guldur Ringwraith to collect the Ringwraith who guarded the Brandywine Bridge and the horses that they had left behind. The three Ringwraiths then watch Crickhollow through the night until the next morning.[1]
29_September: Gandalf, Frodo Baggins, Bilbo Baggins, Galadriel and Elrond leave Middle-earth on the White Ship and pass over the Sea.
30_September: Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.

1_November: At their arrival in the Shire, the four Hobbits are arrested at Frogmorton[1] by the First Eastfarthing Troop and taken to the Shirriff-house.
2_November: The above event was commemorated in Buckland by sounding the Horn of the Mark and other festivities.
3_November: End of the War of the Ring
4_November: Following the Battle of Bywater, restoration of the Shire begins. Frodo frees the prisoners of the Lockholes, including Lobelia Sackville-Baggins, Fredegar Bolger and Will Whitfoot.
